page.title: 03The Glassworks
page.content: coal mines.Today it is owned by GEC Osram Lamp Company, and Thorn EMI. It employs 167 people:133 men and 34 women..29 are employed in the office and 138 in the factory.No women are involved in glass making,they cut,grind and pack glass products 24 hrs/day.Night shift is worked by 46 men.No women work night shift.In 1980 the works employed 700 people.Employment has been as high as 1100.A glassblower's apprenticeship lasts 3 years:they never stop learning.Most employees work a 42 hour week and live within 2 miles of the works. Products include blown electric street lighting bulbs;glass tubing;quartz tubing for electric fires; admiralty ruby bulbs for warships ; coloured airport runway lights ; glass containers and pressed glass for instrument panels.
